info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 2:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central La Paz, northeastern Imperial and Riverside Counties through 315 PM MST/315 PM PDT/... At 226 PM MST/226 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palo Verde, or 33 miles north of Martinez Lake, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blythe, Nicholls Warm Springs, Blythe Airport, Cibola, Palo Verde and Ripley. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 130 and 150. CA Route 78 between mile markers 69 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
